title: Orangutan appears on BBC Breakfast – with a Spy in the Wild twist
text:
Orangutan appears on BBC Breakfast – with a Spy in the Wild twist 
The ape was actually a robot used to film a new BBC nature show Thursday 19 January 2017 17:47 BST Click to follow 
BBC Breakfast welcomed an unconventional guest on the morning of January 19, with an orangutan appearing to join Charlie Stayt and Steph McGovern in the studio. 
However, in an even stranger twist the orangutan was actually a lifelike robot model. 
The uncanny ape was used to film new BBC One nature show Spy in the Wild , which uses hidden camera technology to film its subjects. 
The orangutan, named Beruti, appears in the latest episode of the show, airing on Thursday at 8pm. BBC's Spy in the Wild uses robot animals to get intimate wild footage 
“Beruti is absolutely fantastic,” said an impressed Stayt. “The idea is that Beruti is placed in the wild with real orangutans. 
“It’s quite extraordinary. They get this fantastic footage, because one of his eyes has a camera in there so he can see and record what’s happening.” Spy in the Wild: 10 robot animals from BBC's nature show Spy in the Wild: 10 robot animals from BBC's nature show 1/11 Spy in the Wild 
The BBC's new nature show puts realistic animal robots into the wild to capture intimate footage of elusive creatures. Meet 10 of them in our gallery. John Downer Prod/BBC/Steve Downer
